frameDefinitions: An Agent enacts an Action that is intended to be performed again at one or more later Occasions.
An Agent actively maintains or improves their level of phyiscal fitness.
An Agent causes a Patient to be affected, sometimes by a particular Means or by use of an Instrument.
This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings.
An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal.
frameExamples: I <t>practiced</t> my song for the play.
A professional dishwasher doesn't <t>do</t> dishes with a rag anymore!
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally in order to prepare for a later <fen>Occasion</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the <fen>Action</fen> in preparation for later performances of the same type.
The later enactment or enactments that the <fen>Agent</fen> expects to perform. Note that the <fen>Agent</fen> does not have to have specific <fen>Occasion</fen>s in mind.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> practices.
This role identifies the place where the practicing occurs.
The person who is trying to improve or maintain their physical fitness.
The time that the <fen>Agent</fen> exercises.
The location of the Agent while exercising.
This role identifies the act that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional act that affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
Patient is the entity acted on and that may, but need not, undergo a change.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
listRoleExamples: Little Dieter practiced <fex>playing the piano</fex> all day.
<fex>For our brother's wedding</fex> we had to rehearse the dinner twenty times.
Our band practices <fex>on the football field</fex>.
<fex>The manager</fex> exercises before and after work.
A professional dishwasher does <fex>dishes</fex> one at a time.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he attempted to put the wig on.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the last hundred years or so
Science and Practice of Strength Training
The Year of the Consulship of Ravilla
